creator.name: Middelburgse Commercie Compagnie (MCC)
creator.his_func: The Middelburg Commerce Company (MCC) traded with European ports in the Baltic, France, the Iberian peninsula, and the Mediterranean, but also with Africa and the West Indies. After 1730, when the West India Company (WIC) lost its monopoly in the slave trade, the MCC developed into a major player in this line of business. Over a hundred triangular voyages between Europe, Africa, and the Netherlands Caribbean colonies were carried out. The MCC employed agents in the colonies, who supplied the Directors with market information.
